title: Always excellent service
body: The care of the entire team was exemplary. The GPs were kind and extremely professional and made me feel at ease during the consultation. My appointment was organised with great ease and swiftly, which was useful as I work unsociable hours. The organisation of the vaccination programme was efficient and very well organised!

title: Awful Practice - Unable to get through to speak‚Ä¶
body:
I have been trying to get through to speak to someone at this practice for three days, to enquire about when my 86 year old mother and 89 year old father will be getting a the coronavirus vaccine. I have not been lucky enough to speak to a receptionist however, the messages advise me a lot of "Do Nots" Do not leave a message, Do not come to the surgery, Do not request prescription the list of  "Do not's" goes on.  There is no message about the vaccine or advice how we can enquire about when my parents can expect an invite for the vaccine. Due to the lack of help and advice from this practice I am now going to report my experience to NHS England.   
I know GP practices are under pressure however, for elderly people on line services is not acceptable for all. Patients need to speak to a receptionist elderly patients are vulnerable and there is no exceptions for elderly patients at this practice, this is  very disappointing  This practice should priorities their older patients as they are vulnerable.

title: Lovely Nurse so Kind
body: Thank you to the lovely nurse who helped my mum this morning she was so overwhelmed by her kindness and having both her ears syringed in one appojntment has made such a huge difference to her life and saved her a second trip to the surgery. X

title: Mixed Review
body: Normally I have experience good practice when I have requested my repeat prescriptions but this time I found my experience disappointing. I put my prescription In within the normal timescale of three days and it wasn‚Äôt signed off until the 4th day. This left me feeling anxious as I was concerned I would run out. To be told twice by the receptionist they were under extreme pressure and had hundreds of prescriptions to deal with left me feeling very concerned and I felt lacked care, and compassion  because I had complied with the rules and is disrespectful to my treatment. Having worked for an NHS service for many years I can fully understand the pressures of various services. I have been with this practice for many years and this is the first time I have experienced something which impacted negatively on me as this episode caused me undue stress and I sincerely hope it does not happen again.

title: Brilliant experience
body: Very efficient and caring staff .  They have kept me informed from the beginning of what and when will happen. I have had both eyes cateracs removed with fabulous results .Thank you to all the team

title: Excellent practice
body: I had my covid vaccine excellent staff and brilliant organisation, felt very safe highly recommended üòÅ

title: Speedy well organised vaccine
body: Thanks so much for the amazingly fast and well organised covid vaccination of older people. My dad has had his second dose today. I hear from others round the country they haven‚Äôt even been called fir dose 1 yet. Thank you HGH

title: Fantastic Team
body: Lovely staff both in the registration booth & those vaccinating. Efficient, quick & painless in both departments. Well done all in these difficult times. Nice to see staff smiling although they‚Äôre working long hours. A deserved good review.

title: Total lack of communication.
body: I am aware of the pressures of nursing staff are under but when unable to visit loved one who you last saw fighting for their life on your bedroom floor, the iPad seasons often missed with no explanation so left at home waiting and worried, when call for update to be told ‚Äú continuing treatment‚Äù does not put loved ones at ease,

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring attitude
body: No waiting, geared up for Covid! Free parking and plenty of it. The doctor was knowledgeable in my rare condition and sympathetic along with being honest! Best appt I‚Äôve had for years!

title: Great bedside manner
body:
After speaking to 111 to request a doctor visit to my husband the response was prompt and efficient the doctor came within the hour
So professional and thorough with excellent bedside manner
Explained everything in detail took time to make sure we understood what the doctor was saying
Such a reassuring kind doctor 
Thank you

title: Fantastic family practice
body: We have always received care quickly when our children have been acutely unwell. Most recently my 3 year old attended for his immunisations which were given by a nurse who engaged with him and made an uncomfortable situation a very good experience. I couldn't ask for better care for our family. Thank you.

title: Brilliant staff
body: My parents have recently been called to have their COVID vaccine. The staff arranged the times and when we arrived we were taken straight in out of the cold. It was so well organised. My dad can‚Äôt stand for long due to his condition so this was much appreciated. The receptionists are so helpful and understanding, especially at the really difficult time. It would seem that some other practices are not so organised so Snow Hill should be very proud of themselves. Thank you and keep up the good work

title: Terrible Doctors
body: No empathy from the Doctors there, they didn't help me, and needed medication, only got it after complaining, needed other help, haven't received it,  no one allowed to go to surgery, doctor could have come to me instead, but didn't, because of Covid was the excuse, rude to me, and only prescribed meds to me after I complained, reception doesn't help either, rude to me, useless surgery, will be changing my doctor for one that cares,

title: Great practice
body: Really professional team. Went for my covid injection today, Extremely well organised and very nicely done. Thank you

title: So friendly and efficient
body: Came to get my covid vaccination with my practice. All the staff from the door to the vaccinators and the stewards showing us through were so friendly. Very well run clean and efficient. Thank you all

title: Great experience
body: Stunning clean modern practice. Very well organise process to get my Covid vaccine today. Highly recommended.

title: Amazing staff
body:
Took my son to urgent care today. We were home within an hour. The care and treatment received was first class. 
Even during such trying times we are still able to access A class healthcare. Thank you!

readBy.name: Dartford and Gravesham NHS Trust

title: Great Example of a NHS hospital
body: I went to the minor injuries department. Friendly welcome very efficient staff clean throughout. Everyone I'm met were a credit to our NHS.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: EFFICIENT SERVICE
body: We took a 94 and 90 year old for their Covid jabs 9.1.21. Both have mobility problems. The whole process from the car parking organisers to the people on the door to the nurses and doctor was efficiently executed to a very high degree. Every single member of the team treated all attending with such respect and utmost friendliness and humour it was a joy to be part of this momentous historical event. It was a very touching experience and a kick in the teeth to all the negative press that seems to be at the forefront these days. Everyone involved should be congratulated on their hard work today. They‚Äôve proven today that it can be done.

readBy.name: NHS Sheffield ICB
Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

title: Felt like a burden
body: I had a bleeding bladder and called nhs111. I was advised to go to urgent care without delay. Once there, without a check up the doctor diagnosed it was a urine infection and sent me home with antibiotics. Despite some of answers to his questions were "no" which didn't relate to urine infection. He was also grumpy for wasting time.

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Excellent standards of care
body:
I brought my disabled father for his Covid injection. A very well organised clinic . The staff were friendly and caring .The after are was excellent . 
True nHs heroes . Thank you for your care and attention .

title: Outstanding service
body: The doctors were polite, caring and kind. The entire team were friendly and approachable. I felt very looked after. The way the surgery adhered to social distancing should be replicated by all other surgeries in Birmingham - I felt safe to go there and the system was organised and efficient. Thank you for your hard work.

title: Fantastic Team at the surgery
body: My experience with the surgery has been exceptional.  Despite the COVID pandemic pressures, the entire team were calm and organised which really put me at ease during the vaccination process. My appointment was booked extremely quickly and the queue was well organised so the whole process didn't take long at all. At the same time, the doctors were attentive to detail as was in my case, and you could see they genuinely care about each individual patients. I'd recommend the surgery to anyone who wants organised and patient centred care.

title: Exceptional staff
body: I have been a patient with the practice for seven years now. Over this period of time I have noticed that the Doctor's, Nurses, Receptionists, have all been remarkably helpful and seem to go the extra mile so to speak. They go beyond the call of duty, and do so with such a pleasant attitude and with a smile üòÉ, which after a long day dealing with many phone calls, patients, and of late the covid 19, epidemic, it's a wonder that they have the constant ability to be so remarkably helpful and so very pleasant. I have some serious health conditions, and feel exceptionally lucky to be a patient of this marvelous practice. I have been treated with such respect, and so much help given whenever I have needed it. Everybody seems to be so very efficient, helpful and polite and have helped make me feel so special. I feel confident that I will be treated with such professionalism, understanding and kindness. You have to go a long way to receive the standard that you get at this particular surgery.  I would like to finish by thanking everybody at the surgery, it is a team effort and it is a wonderful team that make up this practice. Thank you so very much to all of you.     Susan Brodie.

title: Great job
body: The team here were kind and compassionate and looked after all my needs. They made me feel relaxed and the treatment was worthwhile considering u waited 18 months.

title: Excellent service and speedy response
body:
Had a scc on forehead. Response from online consulting to examination by gp to referral and treatment by hospital and final follow up letter. Very impressed by the speed and professional treatment by all   involved. System is very well 'joined up'. We are very fortunate to have HPGP.
Thanks.

title: Excellent treatment
body: I was on ward 8 for an operation on my bladder for cancer treatment. Everyone on the ward and in the operating theatre couldn‚Äôt do enough for me. I can‚Äôt praise everyone at Stafford hospital enough. Thank you to you all

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: High Dependency Unit
body: I have recently been in the High Dependency Unit following a double operation and I also have the added complication of Pulmonary Hypertension which is very frightening  . Great care was taken with my operation by the colorectal and gynaecological team and the anaesthetist who corresponded with Papworth Hospital at all times. The staff in the High Dependency Coronary Unit went above and beyond the call of duty  at all times to make me feel safe and secure in a very frightening time where relatives were not allowed to be present. They worked tirelessly all day and night and I cannot praise then highly enough. Working in a hospital must be so tiring at all times without the complication of Covid 19 but I was never made to feel that I was a nuisance, I was given incredible care and understanding and everything was cleaned endlessly throughout the day so a huge thank you to those people who must not be named but you know who you are. If you need to go to Derriford please be assured you will get the very best attention.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Plymouth NHS Trust

title: Vaccine
body: Well organised. Smooth running of vaccine service over the weekend. I had my covid vaccine yesterday. Reception and organising staff was very helpful, guiding throughout the way. Well planned social distancing measures despite high turnout on the day

title: Friendly and efficient
body: As a healthcare worker I had my Covid Vaccine today. Very quick and efficient process. Staff very friendly. Thx

title: Good management
body:
Fair management of the vaccination service provided. Area was clean. Good parking facilities.
Exiting gentlemen was a little abrupt but  overall decent service provided for a good cause.

title: Disgusting Service
body: The receptionist staff at this practice are consistently extremely rude in manner. They have no idea how to talk to members of the public and lack good customer service training. I appreciate that they work under a considerable amount of pressure at times but these receptionists and the practice manager are very disrespectful, break confidentiality and don‚Äôt seem to care if they lose their jobs or not. Absolutely disgusting practice.

title: Fantastic practice
body: I had my 2nd coronovirus vaccine  jab today and must congratulate the staff at Attenborough Surgery for their efficiency. They are all so pleasant and good humoured and have been for the two years I have been been going there.

title: Great, organised practice
body: Had my COVID vaacine done this morning,practice was extremely organised and efficient, with all social distancing measures in place,was very impressed! Would definitely recommend.

title: Outstanding Professionalism and Care
body: I gave birth to twin girls on New Years Eve. I was dealt with the upmost care by my doctor, midwifes, nurses, and the whole team on the day of delivery. My girls came earlier than planned, at 34 weeks. The actual delivery and wanting the option to have c-section was dealt with very well. Sound and supportive advice was given and I was very impressed with the professionalism during the operation. Not only this, the after care I received in the following days at NICU was outstanding.  I spent a total of 10 days at RUH and I‚Äôm so happy to be living in Bath and have the support of all the NHS staff during my time spent in hospital.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Efficient and organised
body: Came to this practice to have my Covid-19 vaccine today. Very efficient and organised practice, didn‚Äôt queue for longer than 5 minutes and the doctor that administered my vaccine was happy to take his time in answering any questions I had. Staff were friendly and ensured social distancing was in place throughout the building and hand sanitiser always available.

title: Very efficient reassuring service
body: I came for an ultrasound scan and from the receptionists to the practitioners  I was treated promptly, courteously and efficiently. The hospital is well sign-posted and pleasantly presented. I was so impressed.  Thank you to all concerned.

readBy.name: Cornwall Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very pleased with the care!
body:
I was very happy with the service I received throughout my pregnancy and afterwards.  I was worried that Covid would affect the care I receive but I did not have any negative experience.
All the staff were very supportive and helpful which was a relief as this was my first baby. 
Thank you so much!

title: Excellent practice
body:
I have been a patient of this practice for a long time and the skill and patience I have always received has been wonderful. Over the years I have been treated with great kindness and consideration.
I can not thank them enough.

title: Vaccinations well organised
body: From the telephone invitation to the cheerful guides on the way out, this was an efficient and kind process.

title: Great practice
body: The surgery is very professionally run to a high standard. No matter how busy my doctor is, she always get back to me ASAP, my nurse also. If they're not satisfied with me over the phone then they'll ask me to come straight in.

title: Help, friendly and professional
body:
Just a shout out for the great reception staff, nurses, doctors and repeat prescription staff for their continued support during such difficult times.  Keep up the good work and a big thank you from both of us.
Anna and Gerald Carter

title: Exemplary vaccine service
body:
I posted the following on my Facebook page regarding my wife and my visit to Brocklebank yesterday -

"Somewhat alarmed at TV news clips of long queues of punters waiting for their covid vaccines, we turned up for our Saturday 9:40am jabs with trepidation.
"Our Brocklebank surgery in south-west London was incredibly efficient - greeted at doors, checked in, vaccinated by doc, 15-minute rest, and out by 10am.
"Absolutely brilliant NHS. We can do it when we try."

title: Wonderful practice
body: We have just had our Covid vaccinations and I can't speak highly enough of the treatment we received.Having belonged to this practice for nearly 80 years,I have always found it to be helpful,friendly and medically sound and as much as I don't like having to make an appointment,I've always been treated so well,by all the staff and doctors.Even while the world is really suffering with the pandemic,they've always been able to fulfil my needs, whether it's either a phone appointment or query,so I'm so grateful to belong to Lane End surgery

title: Good service
body:
Had a phone call late Friday  afternoon  to arrange our covid injections for next day even though we werent in the age group that were being done.
Went on the Saturday  evening and the organisation was second to none, extremely  streamline and trouble free. The staff need to be applauded  as they are working so hard to make us all safe against this atrocious  illness.
The while process took less than 45 mins.

title: Fantastic practice
body: I had my Covid 19 vaccine today and the process was very quick and efficient. The entire team were extremely friendly and organised. Thank you for your service!

title: Covid 19 clinic.
body: I received my covid 19 vac on the 9th Jan.  I would like to say thank you to all the staff at the session for the efficient way the service was delivered.  I was leaving the surgery 25 minutes after arriving (including15 minutes waiting after injection).  WELL DONE and thank you.

title: Covid -19 innoculatioms
body:
Dad has just had his 2nd jab this morning.
Well done to everyone there very slick....thank you 
Very quick, efficient, and friendly

title: Excellent practise
body: I have been with this surgery for 20+ years, thankfully I am still with them. I have NEVER had a rude or unpleasant receptionist maybe because I like to treat people as I want to be treated. They have a job to do and under these extreme circumstances please be more tolerant, patience is a virtue. The Doctors are very kind and understanding and in my experience always found them caring and will go to extremes to help you. So under these circumstance, say something nice and that alone will make you feel so much better. Thank you , think yourself lucky you a good surgery as believe me there are far worse out there.

title: Fantastic AMSDEC nurse
body: My GP surgery requested for me to be seen as an emergency admission at AMSDEC in Colchester Hospital. The nurse in my bay was on her own as they were short staffed, I believe due to covid, but she was lovely, polite, caring and professional at all times. She maintained this approach all through her extremely long shift and I want to thank her for listening to me as I was extremely distressed. She truly is an NHS hero and a role model to all.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I have been a patient at the surgery for 15 years I have received very good friendly and professional treatment from all of the team there . It's easy to criticise at this difficult time but being patient helps. I would recommend this practice

title: An exemplary standard of care
body: We recently attended the vaccine clinic at the end of a long working day at Fulwell Cross Medical Centre. Despite the late hours, the staff could not have been kinder, more supportive or more caring. The vaccine was administered efficiently with the appropriate checks in place. I know many people are involved in working tirelessly to set up these clinics in these uncertain times, but I am especially grateful to the GPs for going above and beyond to keep the local population safe. Truly exemplary service in the NHS, setting the bar for the standards of care high. Thank you!

title: Fantastic Surgery!
body: I would like to place on record my total satisfaction for the professionalism shown by the NHS and practice staff in administering both doses of the Covid vaccine to my 91 year old mum. Well done to the Management and all concerned for a truly magnificent job!

title: Can‚Äôt fault the service 10/10
body:
Had reason to use A&E on Saturday would like to thank everyone for the excellent and  professional care I received.

Couldn‚Äôt have been better. From triage to X-ray and plaster.

Thank you so much.

title: wonderful practice. Lovely staff and doctors
body: last attended for a flu jab.very efficient. have had call backs from doctors regarding an ear infection, which was resolved quickly by a very efficient examination and prescription for antibiotics.could not have wished for better treatment.excellent. Thankyou everyone.

title: Ward 29
body: Would like to thank the staff on Ward 29 for looking after my wife who was there for xmas time they were all brilliant very caring kept me up to date with all her medical progress lovely people She is at home now and much better

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Service
body: Had my Covid vaccinations today. Staff were very friendly whilst organising everyone and ensuring infection control procedures were followed.

title: Juniper Ward - Sterling Service
body: Had a Colonoscopy in Juniper yesterday, the most efficient service I have ever received. All staff from the domestic to the Dr were absolutely on point. They ensured I was kept safe from Corona Virus and my colonoscopy went without a hitch from booking in to leaving the department. Thank you for such a great experience of a bit so nice procedure. Well done all.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Brilliant, fast help
body: Very happy with walk in centre phone appointment. I phoned up yesterday not sure if they were even giving appointments. I was explained that they only offer telephone appointments. This was actually a lot more convenient than driving there and then waiting to be seen in room full of ill people while feeling not well. I received call back in 2hours time while i just sat on my sofa. The doctor i spoke to after quick chat prescribed antibiotics, found a pharmacy that was open late on Saturday and faxed prescription immediately. All i had to do was to drive there and pick it up. I wish this was normal practice so much easier and comfortable when you are ill.  I understand that sometimes you just need to be seen physically but in my case telephone was enough. Very happy. Much easier than my usual gp telephone appointments. Thank you.

title: Impressively efficient
body:
I had my first COVID-19 vaccination and I am very impressed with all concerned. I was vaccinated within five minutes of arrival and treated by everyone with kindness and courtesy. The practice should be very proud of the way in the way the process was organised.
Two words come to mind, impressive and considerate.

title: Excellent
body:
I attended Walsall Manor Hospital yesterday to attend for a Covid-19 Vaccine. I was worried about parking, having travelled from Worcester and not knowing the area, and after reading some very negative reviews online. However, i needn't have worried because the car park was fabulous, very well lit and clearly line spaced. I parked in car park B and it couldn't have been more simple. I just drove up to the barrier, which lifted almost immediately and parked my car. There was ample spaces. Paying was very easy (even for someone like me who is not tech savy). Payment machines are right outside of the exit doors and you can pay by card or cash. I have to return on 20th March and looking forward to it.
Nurses were fabulous too - Angels as ever!

readBy.name: Walsall Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Most wonderful experience
body: Every aspect of my care from all staff was outstanding. I cannot express how grateful and privileged I have been to have my operation here. Thank you all so much.

title: Phlobotomy
body: I attended for a blood test, and it was quite full, social distancing of course. Two gentlemen were talking to each other, very loudly, so consequently no one could hear when being called. Also an old man was quite confused, and was told to return to his seat several times. The lady called, but as no one could hear, no one moved. The next patient was called louder. Next, I was called, very loudly. When I asked if it was me she called before, she was quite irate with me, I said no one could hear, but she brushed this aside. The old man again came along the corridor, and was told, with attitude, to wait, and asked if he‚Äôd checked in. Of course, he hadn‚Äôt, that was why he wasn‚Äôt called. I feel the phlobotonist was very sharp, and I felt she could have spoken to the elderly man a little more  quietly! It‚Äôs very confusing for everyone at the moment, we are all aware of the pandemic, but we have to still treat people with the dignity they deserve. When old people come to hospital, they will be on their own so someone should show them what to do, not bawl at them! Also, if the nurse knew that patients couldn‚Äôt hear her, why didn‚Äôt she just ask the men to speak quietly!!

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great group of people.
body: Very pleased and relieved to find a smooth efficient system when attending for my first corona virus jab. Also noticed how well they looked after the wheelchair users. Congratulations!

title: Amazing team and fabulous support
body:
Big thank you to all the staff at the birthing centre/ midwifery unit at RVI Newcastle. I don't think my experience could have been much better. The care and compassion shown by staff is a credit to their wider service. They were absolutely fantastic support at one of the hardest times and despite all the changes with covid strived to make it just as pleasant and memorable. 
Given medical intervention was required I got to experience the wider team support so extend my thank you to the medical staff on the ward and all the team in theatres and recovery. 
Truly fantastic team that support your needs throughout despite all the changes covid may have caused the maternity care setting. 
Thanks Kathryn

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful care from all staff
body: I was admitted to EAU on xmas eve. After suffering abdominal cramps and diarrhoea for over 3 weeks and after taking a turn for the worse my GP insisted I go to A & E. Thankfully as I was in so much discomfort I was swiftly triaged and after various blood tests I was admitted to AAU. I stayed in purple suite for one night and was transferred to EAU on xmas day! I was very weak as I'd not retained food for over 3 weeks. The staff were gentle and caring and encouraged me to eat. Being xmas there were not many doctors around but nevertheless I felt safe and cared for at all times. On the Sunday after christmas, services started kicking in and I had an xray with another procedure the following day. Tests started in earnest and I was monitored all the time by the wonderful nurses. I ended up being in EAU for a week.  I was broken when I went in but came out repaired and diagnosed with full follow up plan. In all my years I had never spent a night in hospital! This episode came as a complete shock to me but I wanted to record my utmost thanks and appreciation for all the care and attention I received at a time when covid was running rampant through other parts of the hospital. Your dedication is inspiring and I thank you for it. I'm home and recovering and it's all thanks to the doctors, nurses, porters and cleaning staff. You all amazing. Thank you xx

readBy.name: West Hertfordshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: General care
body: I was admitted on 17th Dec with prostate cancer and spinal issues . I was treated rapidly and efficiently and with consummate professionalism . I was not released until the New Year and would like in particular to thank all the staff on Beech C ward where Iwas treated with faultless kindness , sympathy and understanding by staff at all levels . If it is not considered inappropriate I would like to unreservedly commend Sue and Stevie who responded to my every need with tremendous kindness and professionalism . I hope all staff concerned can be made aware of this feedback .

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust
x North Cumbria Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Poor service
body: Called 111 for my daughter. She had been badly let down by the Nhs in the summer and was experiencing the same symptoms again. This was explained to the operator who dismissed her and told her to ring her gp. Fortunately we ignored this called 999 who attended promptly and advised going to A&E. we did this and she ended up in hospital for a week. No I would not trust 111

readBy.name: Healthwatch Wokingham

title: Great Service
body:
Last Sunday whilst taking down our artificial Christmas Tree, a branch scratched my left eye. We were advised by 111 to go to Eye Casualty in Nottingham. I received super service from the nurse who took my temperature, to the two lovely gentlemen at Reception. 

The Nurse Practitioner was fabulous! She explained each step what she was going to do during my eye examination, and was calm and gentle. I felt comfortable with her and trusted her. I appreciated her advice on how to treat my eye over the next 5 days and followed it to the letter! 

I was so grateful to be seen especially during the pandemic! Please pass on my positive review to the hard working people in Eye Casulty! 

Yours Sincerely 
Debbie Oliver

readBy.name: Gastroenterology Department, Queen's Medical Centre

title: Hard working staff
body:
I don‚Äôt have any problems with this practice. Have lived in ‚Äúvillage‚Äù all my life and obviously things have changed due to number of people residing here. Try getting someone else to call if you are at work and have limited time or leave your number with reception asking them to call you back. 
Allow enough time for prescriptions to be processed. Putting in too early causes problems with storage and safety. 
Treat doctors, nurses and reception staff with the respect they deserve. 
Patience is a virtue - remember people are doing their best.

title: COVID vaccination
body: I got my COVID vaccination yesterday. The staff were efficient and kind and I was through the whole process in half an hour, BUT most of that time was spent in fairly crowded rooms on chairs that were nowhere near 2 metres apart, in some cases less than a metre. This made me feel very vulnerable - I am 83 with diabetes and other conditions.

title: Vaccination
body:
I am not a patient at this practice but attended it on Jan 8 for my COVID injection. My appointment was in the early evening so the staff had been on duty for a long time but despite that they were very helpful and cheerful. The organisation was beyond excellence.So smooth , ‚Äòrunning like clockwork ‚Äò would be an understatement! Last but not least , the young man who was ‚Äò In charge ‚Äò of the waiting to leave room was doing a wonderful job of overseeing the organisation of it. He was particularly good at keeping track of when ,especially the older,  people had completed their waiting time and telling them they could leave. 
Pat Amies( patient at Sea Road Surgery)

title: Shocking service
body: Completely disappointed by A&E department after having to wait over 13 hours in the A&E before being admitted to the hospital for an urgent operation that was later on postponed for two days even though the patient was in extreme pain and unable to move properly.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Super efficient!!
body:
I visited the practice today to assist my Mum as she was called for her Pfizer Vaccination . Mum was apprehensive about the visit, however, I have to say we were incredibly impressed. We were met at the door & greeted , the assisted every step of the way with clear & calm instruction. The nurse administering the vaccine was very warm , welcoming & pleasant & we didn‚Äôt feel at all rushed.
The 2 ladies taking charge in the waiting area afterwards were great & very calming & friendly towards every patient !!
We just wanted to say ‚ÄúWell Done Everyone & Thank You Very Much for making it such a pleasant & calm experience ‚Äú!!

title: Excellent response time and servive
body: Within 2.5 hours of my call to 111 on a Saturday I received my telephone consultation with the lovely doctor and collected my prescription. I am so thankful for this excellent service and hope it stays in place as the normal service. Everyone I dealt with from 111 to the pharmacist were just great - thank you! A huge improvement on the previous out of hours service.

title: Outstanding service
body: I have been a patient of the practice for almost 7 years . Doctors , nurses and reception have constantly provided outstanding service .! Highly recommended practice.!

title: Coronavirus vaccination
body: Had my vaccination yesterday. The appointments system seems to have broken down due to overdemand. However, the two practices(Burnbrae and Sele) worked extremely well together. The staff and volunteers worked as a joint team most  efficiently. They seemed to work together well, and were efficient, cheerful, and all extremely helpful. Well done to you all; you are a credit to your profession.

title: gratitude for brave frontline health workers
body: I attended the hospital Saturday 9/1/21 being confirmed COVID positive from the 4/1/21. Having hardly slept and continuous coughing for five days and nights the doctor i saw in the COVID secure unit at 3.00pm checked me over and prescribed a cough suppressant which to me was like a miracle cure. I have had the first good nights sleep of the new year. I want the doctor and his team who dealt with me to know  how grateful I am for their professionalism dedication to duty and bravery carrying out their duties under very stressful conditions. Thank you and stay safe.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excessive waiting and Urgent Treatment Centre
body: I attended the urgent treatment centre on New Year‚Äôs Eve with severe pain due to a pilonidal abscess. I ended up waiting 4 hours to be seen and due to covid my mum wasn‚Äôt allowed to wait with me. After 4 hours I was taken to S.A.U and waited another 3.5 hours to be seen by a doctor only to find out that at 11:30 in the evening I was going to be kept in overnight. Credit to the staff in the S.A.U who were friendly and helpful. I was then eventually moved to the ward at 2am and had surgery around roughly 10am. Some staff on the ward were rude and ignored the requests of patients, including myself, leaving me in the dark despite asking on several occasions what was happening. After being discharged on New Year‚Äôs Day at 6pm I was told to return to the urgent treatment centre to get my packing and bandages changed. I did this the following day and found myself waiting another 3 hours to be seen to then be told the packing the hospital had given me was the wrong one. I have found that on further visits to the urgent treatment centre, despite making appointments, there is still a lengthy wait (for example, for when I arrived for one appointment, I waited an hour and a half). Not only this but there have been occasions where there have been so many people gathered in the small space, with very little ventilation not adhering to the 2m social distancing (which is on posters and stickers on the floor around the hospital). I do understand that the NHS is under a lot of pressure but I feel that the waiting times and the attitude of some of the staff is unacceptable.

readBy.name: Walsall Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body: Today I broke my wrist. The treatment I received in A and E was outstanding. It was quick, too. All the practitioners were so kind and efficient. They were so professional and treated me as if I were an intelligent human being. I can‚Äôt praise the hospital enough.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Efficient and caring service
body: Had a dreaded colonoscopy yesterday at Wythenshawe Hospital. I must say that from start to finish I was treated with respect and dignity. I arrived at 10.30 and was all done and had results explained to only 2 hours later. Many thanks

title: Wonderful
body:
In September 2020 I was in caton ward for 5 days I had an operation for trigeminal neuralgia. The neurological team and staff are fabulous. The hospital is first class food, comfort, cleanliness, care and dedication was wonderful.  
I was in terrible pain and even during covid was seen to and operated on swiftly, everyone I saw was kind and caring I salute you all

readBy.name: The Walton Centre NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well organised
body:
My elderly parents had their vaccine on Friday and they both said that the system in place was really good and well run. They were taken well care of and it couldn‚Äôt have gone any better.

Well done to everyone involved in the vaccine roll-out.

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

title: Brilliant staff and care
body:
Taken to A&E 15/12/19 after a terrible accident on the beach, I was soaking wet from the tide, covered in sand an in unbelievable pain.
I was seen immediately by the incredible helpful, reassuring staff from reception to doctors and all who helped in between.
Since then I have received the same profession, kind and caring treatment each time I have attended Fracture Clinic.
A huge thank you to you all, especially when you are trying work in the current, very demanding circumstances.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Was dealt with swiftly and professionally as always . I have been with them for many years and have never had any reason to complain. Reception staff are excellent.

title: Superb organisation
body:
So impressed with the organising this a.m. when came for the vaccination Thank You & Congratulations.
Carol Smetham

title: Fighting the virus
body: I have to congratulate Glenlyn on how well organized was the visit to the vaccine centre.   On a bitterly cold day, numerous volunteers steered patients through the system of obtaining, as in my case, a second jab.  We were told to wait in cars until we were sent for, and it was only a matter of minutes before I was escorted from the car to the nurse waiting for me inside the clinic.   The volunteers were amazing.   Well done, Glenlyn.

author: Ruxpin567
title: GP practice
body:
I am extremely frustrated by my GP practice. I have been prescribed strong analgesia for over a decade now for chronic back and hip problems. On numerous occasions I have gone to collect my prescription and there‚Äôs nothing there for me. It is usually sorted within a day or two, but thats 1-2 days with no medication which you should not suddenly withdraw from.  
During covid, it has become even harder to collect a prescription while also working for the NHS on the frontline. Doing shifts makes going to the pharmacy difficult and more time consuming considering queues. This is something we all just have to accept and be considerate about. Last month I ordered my prescription 6 days prior to when I would run out. I waited purposely until the last day, knowing how busy GP practice‚Äôs are and pharmacists are. I got there to discover no prescription. This left me with no medication for the next day. I had to take a day off work as I struggle to walk due to the pain.  
This month I ordered my prescription 8 days early, worried I may end up in the same situation if a problem arose. I waited until the day before I had none only to discover it had not been done again! On enquiry as to why, I was told it was because I ordered it too early this time and there is also a note saying my prescription needs reviewed! I completely understand the need for review, however I dont understand how a patient is supposed to be aware of this , or that its going to leave me without any analgesic until its too late.  
This is utterly disgraceful! I purposely try not to bother my GP practice as I know how busy they are. Im not sure how ones deals with a situation where appointments are scarce, yet if I dont get one I am left in severe pain. I appreciate reasons why reviews need done, but surely the patient should be made aware a review is needed!  
This has happened to me so many times, even pre -covid & I never do anything because I work in the NHS and completely understand the pressures. But this is just outrageous! I am extremely angry and upset as I go out my way to try and think of the GP practice and the pharmacy, only to find myself suffering.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

author: SLeo
title: Very rude staff
body: Been trying to get through to them was hard enough, didn't matter what time of day it was. When I finally got through, the phone was answered with a very aggressive tone. I explained why I was calling and they answered again aggressively that they didn't understand what I meant, and swore at me. By this point, I gave up as I felt there was no interest in helping me and it was getting increasingly aggressive so I hung up. As Covid won't allow us to walk into the practice without an appointment, you'd think they'd do better to actually have helpful and polite staff answering the phone. I have since switched practices.

author: Daryp66
title: Really good experience today.
body: Attended an appointment which was embarrassing, the GP, Claire, was absolutely first class. She was caring, kind, considerate and competent and made me feel at ease with my problem. I would just like to take this time to thank her and Manor Practice for their continued first-class service towards me.

title: Ex cellent Practice
body: I am 96 years of age and have always received excellent service and care from the Practice. Last week I was unwell and since I am not able to get out a Doctor kindly visited me and after taking medication I am much improved and feeling better.

title: Great practice
body: I would like to thank the doctor who helped my husband last week ,thanks to the doctor he was in and out of hospital in the same day

title: exellent service
body: i went to the mobile ct scanner at wigan infirmary, my visit was well worth it the male and female radiologist were very considerate i was injected  with a contrast dye hardly any  feelings despite the pandemic everything went smoothly they were both very dedicated in there work. top marks

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: A very good and safe experience
body: Very well organised and I felt really safe throughout. Staff monitoring the flow of patients was professional caring helpful and courteous

title: great care from everyone
body: as a recent covid positive with pneumonia patient, I would like to personally thank all the teams from COVID ED (Plym Ward), Crownhill, Clearbrook and Bickleigh Wards for their care and support whilst i have been in hospital for 5days. From being critically ill, I am able to return home to the family - many thanks.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Plymouth NHS Trust

title: Extremely well organised Covid vaccination clinic
body: So very impressed with the whole experience having never visited your practice before to arrive and be greeted outside shown exactly where we needed to go seen promptly by GP and everyone so very polite friendly and welcoming in a very covid safe environment cannot praise you enough for how superbly organised this clinic was on a cold Sunday afternoon thank you

title: Outstanding Service
body:
I went for my Covid vaccine on the first day Trevelyn Medical
started administering and was amazed at just how organised and efficient the service was. The staff were professional, friendly and cheerful, despite some of them standing outside in the cold for several hours. Thank you Trevelyn Medical your outstanding service to the community.

title: Excellent practice
body: Recently had my covid vaccine at this GP surgery. Staff was very friendly and the whole process was well co-ordinated. I went on a weekend for this and was quite impressed to see the whole team working on a weekend for this.

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

title: Amazing service!
body: Staff is extremely professional. We were always looked after and received the best possible care! Thank you very much for all your efforts!

readBy.name: Kingston Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
